programme.title: Bloodline Detectives hosted by Nancy Grace
programme.desc: In 1979, 16-year-old Kim Bryant disappears from outside a Dairy Queen in Las Vegas. Three weeks later, her body is found: she had been sexually assaulted and bludgeoned to death. 40 years later, genetic genealogy finally names the killer.

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives hosted by Nancy Grace
programme.desc: In 1981, Linda Slaten is sexually assaulted and murdered in her Florida apartment while her children sleep. The case goes cold but her sons never give up. 38 years later, forensic genetic genealogy reveals the killer has been nearby all along.

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives hosted by Nancy Grace
programme.desc: In 1983, 22-year-old Diana Hanson fails to return home from a jog. 24 hours later, her body is discovered: she had been sexually assaulted and stabbed. The killer evades justice for 38 years â€” until new science finally catches up.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: Robert Black was a Scottish serial killer and paedophile who was convicted of the kidnap, rape, sexual assault and murder of four girls aged between five and eleven.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: Mark Hobson killed four people in North Yorkshire, England in July 2004. Hobson committed his first two murders within six days of each other. He is currently serving a whole life sentence.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: Bobby Joe Long is an American serial killer and rapist who terrorised the Tampa Bay Area in Florida during 1984. During his eight-month sadistic killing spree, he murdered ten women.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: Robert Berdella was an American serial killer, known as The Kansas City Butcher, who was responsible for drugging, raping, torturing and murdering six young men.
